comments.commentBody: This one went very smoothly. No trouble, except overthought comedy part, and had SIT as in SITCOM.

Of course the DNC was never going to let Sanders win, so there is no surprise, but what could possibly be good about another President Clinton? The prospect is only slightly better than a President Trump. Neither of the Clintons have any concern for the struggles and suffering of the working class of this country, or any other. (In fact they'd like to "bring ALL of us to heel.") She will not hesitate to use the children of the working class as cannon fodder for her warmongering.
Yes, she is a woman - so was Margaret Thatcher....
Any surgeon who claims that the Egyptian pyramids were created to store grain is stupid in my book, be he Black or White.

Are you really going there?? -- Is talking about a woman's wardrobe the best you can do??
Have you bothered to comment on Sanders' clothing whenever he won???, or any of the other financial perks he 's enjoyed along the way?

There is something wrong with your picture.

Although I support Bernie Sanders, the momentous occasion of the first woman presidential nominee stirred my emotions. As the proud father of a wonderful young daughter, I am so happy she will be living in a better country. I was especially touched when the song "I wanna see you be brave.." came on. My daughter and her friends performed the same song for a school event.

Yes, everyone should honor that, I believe.
This is a phenomenal moment in the history of our country. I am proud to have Clinton as our Democratic nominee.

There is only one post the Democrats could offer Sanders that would make any difference: make him Democrat Senate leader. Then he and his supporters would have a great incentive to ensure election of Democratic candidates.

As far as I'm concerned if the Democrats are going to elect that Wall Street mouthpiece Chuck Schumer to that post that isn't much incentive.
And enjoy living under President Trump
You're repeating an obvious lie.  Shame on you.
He seems angrier than Trump.

I hope Bernie has eno itugh class to concede gracefully tonight, and ask his supporters to wholeheartedly support Hillary Clinton for President.

Given his recent angry-man speeches, I won't hold my breath for it. But I hope he surprises me, and does the right thing.
A lot of those women were deeply corrupt and not friendly to democracy.  Gender isn't everything. Not by a long shot.
Yes.  My daughter lived in England when Thatcher died.  She said Thatcher was so disliked that the most popular tune for days after she died was "Ding Dong The Witch is Dead".

Dear T Dillon,

I too lived in the UK (in Scotland) during the benighted reign and celebrated death of Thatcher. I honestly cannot understand why anyone would be excited about the nomination of a woman presidential candidate just because she's a woman. Those people obviously did not have to live under Thatcher. But now they may find themselves having to live under a very Thatcher-like 'leader'.

@otto
Are you stuck somewhere in the 'gender-groove'???
I daresay, many people voted for Clinton because they deemed her to be the candidate best qualified for the job.
It's rather sexist to think otherwise.
Thatcher vs. Berlusconi!  This is gonna be great!

Your argument has a large flaw.

If you remove all the super delegate votes, then you must also lower the threshold that the candidate needs to reach 50% +1 for the nomination.

@AnnGansley, If you want to ensure checks-and-balance to remind HRC to stay on the left, then you have to be on her side first before you can be a whisperer. You don't (and won't, and can't) achieve that by screaming in someone's face, even if you've lost the race already. This is nothing specific about HRC. This has ALWAYS been the chance. If you don't know of this fact, you're probably one of those new voters who don't know or don't care before Sanders came along.

That's why it's important to keep your agenda alive, and I can only tell you, Sanders is not helping your cause and agenda at this point with his course of action. He only serves to aggravate everyone, and endangers your agenda.
Hey give Chelsea a break.  Remember how she rushed to enlist in the military to fight in Iraq after her mother voted for that war.

I think your logic is a bit off. If you take super delegates out of the numerator, you have to take them out of the denominator as well. In other words, to win the majority of pledged delegates, Clinton would need something like 2,025 votes, not 2,384. If Clinton got 2,384 votes from only pledged delegates, that would be huge -- 58% to Sanders' 42%.

This moving the goalposts -- saying Clinton needs to reach a higher standard than a simple majority to actually win -- is a bit like saying Michael Phelps can't get a gold medal just be being faster than everyone, he also has to break a world record for it to be legitimate or "honorable" win -- otherwise someone else deserves to be in 1st place.
What an amazing finish.
The Vegas odds aren't estimating the final vote. The November percentages will be within five points of each other.

She cares deeply about the people Mitt Romney was so fond of- corporations, my friend.  I'm not afraid of a Trump presidency, I'm done with business as usual.  I'm a Bernie supporter who will vote Trump. I'm ready to try anything other than corporatists.

It was easy for Hillary supporters to come around Obama, because they both are identical in many issues. With Bernie, she has way too many differences and I'm not sure if she will ever get the ardent Bernie supporters to convince otherwise.
Nothing is as it used to be.  Hillary and a lot of other people will find that out come election day.

So proud of Hillary and the Democratic Party for taking the higher road. Bernie is a good man and has expanded people's thinking and energized a large group of people. If his supporters believe in democratic ideals they will come around to Hillary just like her supporters came around to Obama in 2008 (I was one of them).

While Hillary isn't perfect (who is?) she has devoted her life to public service and cares about people at her core. Compare that with what the GOP is putting forth and there really is no choice.
David ... you post a link that seems to have no relevant content, and is a blog/chatter thread.

Most of the nuclear power problems have been "technically" solved in the sense that seemingly reasonable solutions have been proposed. However, a lot of what has been proposed has failed (encasing the waste in glass), and the practical problem of moving nuclear waste around has run into NIMBY problems nationwide. Technical solutions are not solutions if they are socially unacceptable.

If you build into the price of the electricity generated by nuclear power the cost of building and decommissioning the plants (never been done, but the estimates are in the billions and the taxpayers, not the utilities, will pay) and the cost of disposing of the waste in a safe, permanent manner, it no longer makes sense to build these plants. There's are good practical reasons people haven't built one of these monstrosities in 30 years despite the "technical" solutions of the engineers.

Leee Harrison once again posts with no knowledge. BNC commenters are largely quite knowledgeable about power systems and matters nuclear. I suggest that site because those who actually wish to learn, as opposed to pontificating, will learn something there. Also, I can post there from my mobile device.

Al Tarheeli --- The TVA has just completed Watts Bar 2, a nuclear power plant. As for the rest, I and others can explain on the BNC site.

I have pointed out several times, at least once on this thread, that the so-called nuclear waste can be disposed of safely; the problem is technically solved. Yet various people do drive-bys claiming the opposite. Annoying, that.

Those who have actual question about aspects of nuclear power plants are invited to ask at
https://bravenewclimate.com/2016/05/01/open-thread-24
I need to use that site due to a technical fault here at TNYT which the site maintenance people refuse to acknowledge.

Try to remember 2000, if you can.  A surplus in the treasury.  Social security looking good.  No major conflicts.  And then Bush Jr. came and pushed us off every cliff he could, and that was a lot of cliffs.  So if you want to pretend that you know Clinton's heart (you don't), or that you are a democrat (?), feel free.  But you're doing republicans' dirty work in this, including personal insults about her marriage (hardly your business).
Why not take the time to read what Clinton has done. it's pretty exciting.

It's very sad that you think you didn't already live in a country like that, most young women today did.  That's why the "I'm a woman" card never resonated with them.  I didn't vote for Obama because he was black, and I won't vote for Hillary because she's a woman.  She still has to earn it like Obama did.  That' is what equality is all about.

No. They won't support Clinton because they care more about making a political statement than the good of the country.
Read the comments. Some are even going to vote for Donald Trump.
Some revolution.
She has won a majority of pledged delegates and would win if the super delegates disappeared right now.  Satisfied?
